title: Aesthetic Options
text: Visual adjustments controlcharts handled dedicated settings arguments. group settings (e.g., canvas, axes, lines) argument (e.g., canvas_settings, x_axis_settings). see full list available options group, can use helper functions spc_default_settings('{group_name}') funnel_default_settings('{group_name}') (e.g., spc_default_settings('x_axis')).

title: Aesthetic Options
text: use following synthetic datasets examples :
code: set.seed(42)  # SPC Data (Time Series) spc_data <- data.frame(   date = seq(as.Date("2023-01-01"), by = "month", length.out = 12),   value = c(10, 12, 11, 15, 12, 11, 25, 12, 11, 10, 11, 12),   group = "A" ) spc_data$label_text <- paste0("Val: ", spc_data$value)  # Funnel Data (Categorical) funnel_data <- data.frame(   id = LETTERS[1:10],   num = sample(10:50, 10),   denom = sample(50:100, 10) )

title: Aesthetic Options
text: title argument allows add plot title customize font position. Note title takes named list parameters.
code: spc(   spc_data,   keys = date,   numerators = value,   title = list(     text = "Monthly Performance",     font_size = "20px",     font_family = "Courier New",     font_weight = "bold"   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
text: canvas_settings argument controls overall plot area, padding. useful labels titles clipped.

title: Aesthetic Options
code: spc(   spc_data,   keys = date,   numerators = value,   canvas_settings = list(     upper_padding = 50,     lower_padding = 50   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
code: funnel(   funnel_data,   keys = id,   numerators = num,   denominators = denom,   canvas_settings = list(     left_padding = 50,     right_padding = 50   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
text: can customize X Y axes using x_axis_settings y_axis_settings. Common options include toggling visibility, rotating ticks, forcing limits.

title: Aesthetic Options
code: spc(   spc_data,   keys = date,   numerators = value,   x_axis_settings = list(     xlimit_tick_rotation = -45,     xlimit_label = "Month of Observation"   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
code: funnel(   funnel_data,   keys = id,   numerators = num,   denominators = denom,   x_axis_settings = list(     xlimit_label = "Population Size (Denominator)"   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
code: spc(   spc_data,   keys = date,   numerators = value,   y_axis_settings = list(     ylimit_show = TRUE, # Ensure axis is shown     limit_multiplier = 2 # Expand the auto-calculated limits   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
text: SPC charts date keys, date_settings controls dates formatted axis tooltips.
code: spc(   spc_data,   keys = date,   numerators = value,   date_settings = list(     date_format_day = "DD",     date_format_month = "Mon", # Abbreviated month     date_format_year = "YY",     date_format_delim = "-"   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
text: line_settings argument allows customization main data lines, including targets limits lines.

title: Aesthetic Options
code: spc(   spc_data,   keys = date,   numerators = value,   line_settings = list(     colour_main = "purple",     width_main = 3,     type_main = "2 5" # Dashed line pattern   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
text: Funnel plots rely heavily control limits. can customize 95% 99% limits independently.
code: funnel(   funnel_data,   keys = id,   numerators = num,   denominators = denom,   line_settings = list(     colour_95 = "orange",     width_95 = 2,     type_95 = "10 0", # Solid     colour_99 = "red",     width_99 = 3   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
text: Control appearance data points using scatter_settings.

title: Aesthetic Options
code: funnel(   funnel_data,   keys = id,   numerators = num,   denominators = denom,   scatter_settings = list(     shape = "Diamond",     size = 8,     colour = "orange",     opacity = 0.8   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
text: Funnel charts allow displaying group key directly scatter points (instead floating tooltips). can customize text using scatter_text_* options.
code: funnel(   funnel_data,   keys = id,   numerators = num,   denominators = denom,   scatter_settings = list(     use_group_text = TRUE,     # Enable text labels on points     scatter_text_colour = "darkblue",     scatter_text_size = 14,     scatter_text_font = "Georgia"   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
text: Data labels can customized via label_settings. can pass column labels argument display custom text.

title: Aesthetic Options
code: spc(   spc_data,   keys = date,   numerators = value,   labels = label_text, # Using the custom column created earlier   label_settings = list(     show_labels = TRUE,     label_position = "bottom",     label_colour = "red",     label_font = "Verdana",     label_size = 10   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
code: funnel(   funnel_data,   keys = id,   numerators = num,   denominators = denom,   labels = id, # Show ID as label   label_settings = list(     show_labels = TRUE,     label_colour = "blue",     label_font = "Arial",     label_size = 12   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
text: powerful feature controlcharts vectorised settings. settings take single value (e.g., colour = "blue"), specific settings accept vector matching length data. allows apply conditional formatting logic directly R. Currently, supported : * scatter_settings (SPC Funnel) * line_settings (SPC )

title: Aesthetic Options
text: SPC example, color data points red exceed value 15.  Funnel example, highlight points high denominator (large population).
code: # Create a color vector matching the data logic point_colors <- ifelse(spc_data$value > 15, "red", "#E69F00")  spc(   spc_data,   keys = date,   numerators = value,   scatter_settings = list(     colour = point_colors,     size = 5   ) )$static_plot # Logic: Highlight large denominators funnel_cols <- ifelse(funnel_data$denom > 80, "green", "gray")  funnel(   funnel_data,   keys = id,   numerators = num,   denominators = denom,   scatter_settings = list(     colour = funnel_cols,     size = 6,     opacity = 1   ) )$static_plot

title: Aesthetic Options
text: can also color different segments main line. useful highlighting specific time periods phases.
code: # Define colors for line segments # Note: The vector length corresponds to the points; segments connect points. line_colors <- rep("gray", nrow(spc_data)) line_colors[5:8] <- "orange" # Highlight a middle section  spc(   spc_data,   keys = date,   numerators = value,   line_settings = list(     colour_main = line_colors,     width_main = 3   ) )$static_plot

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: controlcharts package supports comprehensive range Statistical Process Control (SPC) charts funnel plots. vignette demonstrates available chart types examples usage.

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: package supports 14 different SPC chart types, designed specific data characteristics monitoring scenarios.

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: run chart displays data time without statistical control limits. ’s useful visualizing trends patterns data.
code: # Simulate 24 months of data dat_run <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   y = rnorm(24, mean = 100, sd = 10) )  chart_run <- spc(data = dat_run,                  keys = month,                  numerators = y,                  spc_settings = list(chart_type = "run"))  chart_run$static_plot knitr::kable(head(chart_run$limits), digits = 2)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: individuals chart (also called XmR chart) default chart type. monitors individual measurements control limits based moving range.
code: dat_i <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   y = rnorm(24, mean = 50, sd = 5) )  chart_i <- spc(data = dat_i,                keys = month,                numerators = y,                spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"))  chart_i$static_plot knitr::kable(head(chart_i$limits), digits = 2)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: -charts can also monitor ratios providing numerators denominators. chart automatically calculate plot ratio appropriate control limits.
code: # Example: monitoring average processing time per case dat_ratio <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   total_time = rpois(24, lambda = 120),   num_cases = rpois(24, lambda = 25) )  chart_ratio <- spc(data = dat_ratio,                    keys = month,                    numerators = total_time,                    denominators = num_cases,                    spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"))  chart_ratio$static_plot knitr::kable(head(chart_ratio$limits), digits = 2)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Uses median instead mean centerline, making robust outliers.
code: dat_im <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   y = c(rnorm(20, mean = 50, sd = 5), 75, 78, 72, 71)  # Some outliers )  chart_im <- spc(data = dat_im,                 keys = month,                 numerators = y,                 spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i_m"))  chart_im$static_plot

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: can use median centerline median-based moving range limits.
code: chart_imm <- spc(data = dat_im,                  keys = month,                  numerators = y,                  spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i_mm"))  chart_imm$static_plot

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Plots moving range consecutive measurements.
code: dat_mr <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   y = rnorm(24, mean = 10, sd = 2) )  chart_mr <- spc(data = dat_mr,                 keys = month,                 numerators = y,                 spc_settings = list(chart_type = "mr"))  chart_mr$static_plot

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Monitors proportions numerator exceed denominator (e.g., defect rates, complication rates).
code: dat_p <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   denominator = sample(80:120, 24, replace = TRUE) ) dat_p$numerator <- rbinom(24, size = dat_p$denominator, prob = 0.15)  chart_p <- spc(data = dat_p,                keys = month,                numerators = numerator,                denominators = denominator,                spc_settings = list(chart_type = "p"))  chart_p$static_plot knitr::kable(head(chart_p$limits), digits = 3)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Proportion chart large-sample correction better accuracy varying sample sizes.
code: chart_pp <- spc(data = dat_p,                 keys = month,                 numerators = numerator,                 denominators = denominator,                 spc_settings = list(chart_type = "pp"))  chart_pp$static_plot

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Monitors rates (events per unit exposure), infections per 1000 patient-days.
code: dat_u <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   infections = rpois(24, lambda = 8),   patient_days = sample(200:400, 24, replace = TRUE) )  chart_u <- spc(data = dat_u,                keys = month,                numerators = infections,                denominators = patient_days,                spc_settings = list(chart_type = "u", multiplier = 1000))  chart_u$static_plot knitr::kable(head(chart_u$limits), digits = 2)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Rate chart large-sample correction.
code: chart_up <- spc(data = dat_u,                 keys = month,                 numerators = infections,                 denominators = patient_days,                 spc_settings = list(chart_type = "up", multiplier = 1000))  chart_up$static_plot

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Monitors count data observation represents number events fixed area opportunity.
code: dat_c <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   defects = rpois(24, lambda = 12) )  chart_c <- spc(data = dat_c,                keys = month,                numerators = defects,                spc_settings = list(chart_type = "c"))  chart_c$static_plot knitr::kable(head(chart_c$limits), digits = 2)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Monitors mean samples multiple measurements taken time point.
code: dat_xbar <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   sample_mean = rnorm(24, mean = 100, sd = 3),   sample_size = rep(5, 24),   sample_sd = rchisq(24, df = 4) / 2 )  chart_xbar <- spc(data = dat_xbar,                   keys = month,                   numerators = sample_mean,                   denominators = sample_size,                   xbar_sds = sample_sd,                   spc_settings = list(chart_type = "xbar"))  chart_xbar$static_plot knitr::kable(head(chart_xbar$limits), digits = 2)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Monitors standard deviation samples.
code: chart_s <- spc(data = dat_xbar,                keys = month,                numerators = sample_sd,                denominators = sample_size,                spc_settings = list(chart_type = "s"))  chart_s$static_plot

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Event-based charts use sequential event numbers x-axis rather dates.

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Monitors number non-events events (e.g., days accidents).
code: dat_g <- data.frame(   event = 1:20,   opportunities_between = rpois(20, lambda = 15) )  chart_g <- spc(data = dat_g,                keys = event,                numerators = opportunities_between,                spc_settings = list(chart_type = "g"))  chart_g$static_plot knitr::kable(head(chart_g$limits), digits = 2)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Monitors time intervals events.
code: dat_t <- data.frame(   event = 1:20,   days_between = rexp(20, rate = 1 / 30) )  chart_t <- spc(data = dat_t,                keys = event,                numerators = days_between,                spc_settings = list(chart_type = "t"))  chart_t$static_plot knitr::kable(head(chart_t$limits), digits = 2)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Funnel plots used compare performance across multiple organizations groups, accounting natural variation due different sample sizes.

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: default funnel plot type proportion data. Uses arc-sine transformation.
code: # Simulate complication rates across 10 hospitals denoms_pr <- sample(100:300, 10) dat_pr <- data.frame(   hospital = paste0("Hospital ", LETTERS[1:10]),   complications = rbinom(10, size = denoms_pr, prob = 0.12),   procedures = denoms_pr )  funnel_pr <- funnel(data = dat_pr,                     keys = hospital,                     numerators = complications,                     denominators = procedures,                     funnel_settings = list(chart_type = "PR"))  funnel_pr$static_plot knitr::kable(funnel_pr$limits, digits = 3)

previous_headings: Funnel Plot Types > PR - Proportion Funnel
title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: data shows variation expected, overdispersion adjustment widens control limits.
code: funnel_pr_od <- funnel(data = dat_pr,                        keys = hospital,                        numerators = complications,                        denominators = procedures,                        funnel_settings = list(chart_type = "PR",                                               od_adjust = "yes"))  funnel_pr_od$static_plot knitr::kable(funnel_pr_od$limits, digits = 3)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Used indirectly standardized ratios (e.g., HSMR - Hospital Standardised Mortality Ratio).
code: # Simulate observed and expected deaths dat_sr <- data.frame(   hospital = paste0("Hospital ", LETTERS[1:10]),   observed_deaths = rpois(10, lambda = sample(30:80, 10)),   expected_deaths = sample(30:80, 10) )  funnel_sr <- funnel(data = dat_sr,                     keys = hospital,                     numerators = observed_deaths,                     denominators = expected_deaths,                     funnel_settings = list(chart_type = "SR"))  funnel_sr$static_plot knitr::kable(funnel_sr$limits, digits = 3)

previous_headings: Funnel Plot Types > SR - Standardised Ratio Funnel
title: Chart Types in controlcharts
code: funnel_sr_od <- funnel(data = dat_sr,                        keys = hospital,                        numerators = observed_deaths,                        denominators = expected_deaths,                        funnel_settings = list(chart_type = "SR",                                               od_adjust = "yes"))  funnel_sr_od$static_plot knitr::kable(funnel_sr_od$limits, digits = 3)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Used rate data log transformation.
code: # Simulate infection rates across hospitals dat_rc <- data.frame(   hospital = paste0("Hospital ", LETTERS[1:10]),   infections = rpois(10, lambda = sample(5:20, 10)),   patient_days = sample(500:2000, 10) )  funnel_rc <- funnel(data = dat_rc,                     keys = hospital,                     numerators = infections,                     denominators = patient_days,                     funnel_settings = list(chart_type = "RC",                                            multiplier = 1000))  funnel_rc$static_plot knitr::kable(funnel_rc$limits, digits = 3)

previous_headings: Funnel Plot Types > RC - Rate Funnel
title: Chart Types in controlcharts
code: funnel_rc_od <- funnel(data = dat_rc,                        keys = hospital,                        numerators = infections,                        denominators = patient_days,                        funnel_settings = list(chart_type = "RC",                                               od_adjust = "yes",                                               multiplier = 1000))  funnel_rc_od$static_plot knitr::kable(funnel_rc_od$limits, digits = 3)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: Use od_adjust = "yes" : - Data shows variation expected binomial/Poisson models - clustering hierarchical structure data - Groups different underlying risks captured standardization - Control limits appear narrow observed variation

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: *Optional denominator creates ratio chart **s-chart, numerator contains standard deviation values

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: funnel plot types require: - Keys (organization/group identifier) - Numerators (event counts observed values) - Denominators (sample sizes expected values) Additional constraints: - PR: Numerator must ≤ denominator - SR: Typically observed/expected counts deaths - RC: rate data (events/exposure)

title: Chart Types in controlcharts
text: information, see: - vignette("getting_started") - Basic package usage - vignette("interactive_charts") - Interactive features crosstalk

title: Getting Started with the `controlcharts` package
text: Consider basic time-series, comprised two-years monthly data: default, spc() function construct -chart (individuals chart; also referred XmR-chart): result spc() function list containing three elements: static_plot: static SVG plot SPC chart html_plot: HTML widget containing interactive SPC chart (use Shiny/interactive contexts) limits: data frame containing calculated control limits
code: # Simulate 2 years of monthly data dat <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   y = rnorm(24) )  knitr::kable(head(dat)) spc_chart <- controlcharts::spc(data = dat,                                 numerators = y,                                 keys = month) spc_chart$static_plot # If you are using an interactive environment, you can display the HTML widget: # spc_chart$html_plot # Display the control limits knitr::kable(head(spc_chart$limits), digits = 2)

title: Getting Started with the `controlcharts` package
text: interface provided funnel charts. example, consider proportion data recorded 10 organisations: funnel plots, default proportions (PR) chart:
code: # Simulate proportion data for 10 organisations denoms <- sample(100:200, 10) funnel_data <- data.frame(   organisation = letters[1:10],   numerators = rbinom(10, size = denoms, prob = 0.2),   denominators = denoms )  knitr::kable(funnel_data) funnel_chart <- controlcharts::funnel(data = funnel_data,                                       numerators = numerators,                                       denominators = denominators,                                       keys = organisation) funnel_chart$static_plot knitr::kable(funnel_chart$limits, digits = 2)

title: Portable Interactive Control Charts
text: key limitation interactive plots/charts R need Shiny server order handle data processing statistical calculations. controlcharts package overcomes performing calculations JavaScript, allowing charts fully portable interactive without need server. constructing charts using crosstalk data objects, multiple charts can also linked together allow interactive filtering highlighting fully portable format. controlcharts package also performs necessary data aggregations pre-processing JavaScript. means users need pre-aggregate manipulate data creating charts, simplifying workflow making easier create interactive visualisations directly raw data. also allows dynamic data exploration, users can filter interact charts without needing re-run R code.

title: Portable Interactive Control Charts
text: Consider dataset containing monthly numerators denominators 10 different organisations 2-year period:
code: library(controlcharts)  set.seed(12324)  dat <- do.call(   rbind.data.frame,   lapply(toupper(letters[1:10]), function(grp) {     denom <- sample(0:100, 24)     data.frame(       country = sample(c("C1", "C2", "C3"), 1, replace = TRUE),       organisation = grp,       month_start = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),       numerators = rbinom(n = 24, size = denom, prob = 0.3),       denominators = denom     )   }) ) DT::datatable(dat)

title: Portable Interactive Control Charts
text: SPC charts funnel plots can constructed data directly, resulting HTML plots supporting mouseover tooltips:
code: spc_plt <- controlcharts::spc(data = dat,                               keys = month_start,                               numerators = numerators,                               denominators = denominators,                               spc_setting = list(chart_type = "p"),                               outlier_settings = list(astronomical = TRUE,                                                       shift = TRUE,                                                       two_in_three = TRUE),                               nhs_icon_settings =                                 list(show_variation_icons = TRUE))  fun_plt <- controlcharts::funnel(data = dat,                                  keys = organisation,                                  numerators = numerators,                                  denominators = denominators)   spc_plt$html_plot fun_plt$html_plot

what: Cross-plot Reactivity and Dynamic Calculations: Crosstalk
title: Portable Interactive Control Charts
text: converting data crosstalk::SharedData object, multiple charts can linked together allow interactive filtering highlighting. aggregations, filtering, statistical calculations performed dynamically JavaScript, charts remain fully portable interactive without need Shiny server. can use crosstalk filters allow users dynamically filter data displayed charts. filters adjusted, data aggregations statistical calculations updated real-time within charts:
code: # Convert data to crosstalk SharedData object crosstalk_dat <- crosstalk::SharedData$new(dat)  # Create charts using crosstalk data spc_plt <- controlcharts::spc(data = crosstalk_dat,                               keys = month_start,                               numerators = numerators,                               denominators = denominators,                               spc_setting = list(chart_type = "p"),                               outlier_settings = list(astronomical = TRUE,                                                       shift = TRUE,                                                       two_in_three = TRUE),                               nhs_icon_settings =                                 list(show_variation_icons = TRUE))  fun_plt <- controlcharts::funnel(data = crosstalk_dat,                                  keys = organisation,                                  numerators = numerators,                                  denominators = denominators) country_filter <- crosstalk::filter_select("countryFilter", "Country",                                            crosstalk_dat, ~country) org_filter <- crosstalk::filter_select("orgFilter", "Organisation",                                        crosstalk_dat, ~organisation) date_filter <- crosstalk::filter_slider("monthFilter", "Date",                                         crosstalk_dat, ~month_start) crosstalk::bscols(   date_filter,   org_filter,   country_filter ) crosstalk::bscols(   fun_plt$html_plot,   spc_plt$html_plot )

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: Statistical Process Control (SPC) charts powerful tools detecting signals change processes time. controlcharts package provides comprehensive outlier detection capabilities help identify process shifted baseline state. vignette demonstrates: Four outlier detection methods: astronomical points, shifts, trends, 2--3 patterns Custom detection parameters: adjusting sensitivity shift trend lengths Directional flagging: specifying constitutes improvement vs deterioration NHS icons: variation assurance icons visual interpretation Combined approaches: using multiple detection methods simultaneously outlier detection settings configured outlier_settings parameter, NHS icons configured nhs_icon_settings parameter.

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: Astronomical points (also called astronomical signals special cause variation) individual data points fall outside statistical control limits. default, points beyond 3-sigma limits.  Astronomical points indicate special cause variation - something unusual occurred requires investigation. can adjust limit used flagging changing astronomical_limit parameter “2 Sigma” “1 Sigma”:
code: # Create data with some extreme outliers dat_astro <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   infections = c(rnorm(10, mean = 15, sd = 3),                  28,  # Astronomical point                  rnorm(5, mean = 15, sd = 3),                  6,   # Astronomical point                  rnorm(7, mean = 15, sd = 3)) ) chart_astro <- spc(data = dat_astro,                    keys = month,                    numerators = infections,                    spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                    outlier_settings = list(                      astronomical = TRUE,                      astronomical_limit = "3 Sigma"                    ))  chart_astro$static_plot knitr::kable(chart_astro$limits[9:14, ], digits = 2) chart_astro_2s <- spc(data = dat_astro,                       keys = month,                       numerators = infections,                       spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                       outlier_settings = list(                         astronomical = TRUE,                         astronomical_limit = "2 Sigma"                       ))  chart_astro_2s$static_plot

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: shift occurs multiple consecutive points fall side centerline, suggesting sustained change process. default threshold 7 consecutive points. example shows 6-point shift, flagged default setting:  can customize shift detection changing shift_n. Setting 5 6 now detect 6-point shift:
code: # Create data with a 6-point shift at the end dat_shift <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   satisfaction = c(rnorm(18, mean = 75, sd = 5),  # Baseline                    rnorm(6, mean = 82, sd = 5))   # 6-point shift at end ) chart_shift <- spc(data = dat_shift,                    keys = month,                    numerators = satisfaction,                    spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                    outlier_settings = list(                      shift = TRUE                    ))  chart_shift$static_plot knitr::kable(tail(chart_shift$limits, 10), digits = 2) chart_shift_6 <- spc(data = dat_shift,                      keys = month,                      numerators = satisfaction,                      spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                      outlier_settings = list(                        shift = TRUE,                        shift_n = 6                      ))  chart_shift_6$static_plot

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: Trends detect monotonic increases decreases consecutive points, indicating sustained directional change. default 5 consecutive points consistent direction. example shows 4-point trend, flagged default setting:  Setting trend_n 4 fewer now detect 4-point trend:
code: # Create data with a 4-point upward trend at the end dat_trend <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   wait_time = c(rnorm(20, mean = 30, sd = 3),                 31, 33, 35, 37)  # 4-point increasing trend at end ) chart_trend <- spc(data = dat_trend,                    keys = month,                    numerators = wait_time,                    spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                    outlier_settings = list(                      trend = TRUE                    ))  chart_trend$static_plot knitr::kable(tail(chart_trend$limits, 10), digits = 2) chart_trend_4 <- spc(data = dat_trend,                      keys = month,                      numerators = wait_time,                      spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                      outlier_settings = list(                        trend = TRUE,                        trend_n = 4                      ))  chart_trend_4$static_plot

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: 2--3 rule detects 2 3 consecutive points fall outside 2-sigma (95%) warning limits. pattern suggests early signs process change.  default, points outside limits highlighted. can highlight points pattern setting two_in_three_highlight_series = TRUE:
code: # Create data with 2-in-3 pattern # With mean=120 and sd=5, 2-sigma limits are approximately 120 ± 10 # So values above 130 or below 110 should exceed 2-sigma dat_2in3 <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   pressure = c(rnorm(8, mean = 120, sd = 5),                131, 133, 121,  # 2 out of 3 outside 2-sigma (131 and 133 > 130)                rnorm(13, mean = 120, sd = 5)) ) chart_2in3 <- spc(data = dat_2in3,                   keys = month,                   numerators = pressure,                   spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                   outlier_settings = list(                     two_in_three = TRUE,                     two_in_three_limit = "2 Sigma"                   ))  chart_2in3$static_plot knitr::kable(head(chart_2in3$limits, 12), digits = 2) chart_2in3_all <- spc(data = dat_2in3,                       keys = month,                       numerators = pressure,                       spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                       outlier_settings = list(                         two_in_three = TRUE,                         two_in_three_limit = "2 Sigma",                         two_in_three_highlight_series = TRUE                       ))  chart_2in3_all$static_plot

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: improvement_direction setting specifies constitutes improvement process.   Setting improvement_direction = "neutral" treats outliers equally, distinction improvement deterioration.
code: # For metrics where lower is better (e.g., infection rates) dat_infections <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   infections = c(rnorm(16, mean = 10, sd = 1),                  rnorm(8, mean = 5, sd = 1))  # Improvement (decrease shift) )  chart_inf <- spc(data = dat_infections,                  keys = month,                  numerators = infections,                  spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                  outlier_settings = list(                    shift = TRUE,                    improvement_direction = "decrease"                  ))  chart_inf$static_plot # For metrics where higher is better (e.g., hand hygiene compliance) dat_compliance <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   compliance = c(rnorm(12, mean = 75, sd = 5),                  rnorm(12, mean = 85, sd = 5))  # Improvement (increase) )  chart_comp <- spc(data = dat_compliance,                   keys = month,                   numerators = compliance,                   spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                   outlier_settings = list(                     shift = TRUE,                     improvement_direction = "increase"                   ))  chart_comp$static_plot

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: process_flag_type setting allows filter outliers flagged. useful want alerted deteriorations (improvements) vice versa. First, let’s create data improvement (decrease) deterioration (increase) infection rates: default setting (process_flag_type = ""), improvement deterioration shifts flagged:  Now, setting process_flag_type = "deterioration" flag increase (deterioration), ignoring improvement:
code: # Data with both improvement and deterioration dat_flag_type <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   infections = c(rnorm(5, mean = 8, sd = 1.5),                  rnorm(8, mean = 5, sd = 1.5),   # Improvement (decrease)                  rnorm(11, mean = 10, sd = 1.5))  # Deterioration (increase) ) chart_both <- spc(data = dat_flag_type,                   keys = month,                   numerators = infections,                   spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                   outlier_settings = list(                     shift = TRUE,                     improvement_direction = "decrease",                     process_flag_type = "both"                   ))  chart_both$static_plot chart_det_only <- spc(data = dat_flag_type,                       keys = month,                       numerators = infections,                       spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                       outlier_settings = list(                         shift = TRUE,                         improvement_direction = "decrease",                         process_flag_type = "deterioration"                       ))  chart_det_only$static_plot

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: NHS icons provide standardized visual indicators process variation assurance status.

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: Variation icons indicate type variation present chart. default, icons shown pattern detected last point:  pattern occurs earlier data last point, icon shown default settings:  Setting flag_last_point = FALSE show icons relevant points, just last observation:  can also customize icon placement scaling:
code: # Data with shift ending at the last point dat_var_last <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   readmissions = c(rnorm(10, mean = 12, sd = 2),                    rnorm(14, mean = 16, sd = 2))  # Shift at end )  chart_var_last <- spc(data = dat_var_last,                       keys = month,                       numerators = readmissions,                       spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                       outlier_settings = list(                         astronomical = TRUE,                         shift = TRUE,                         improvement_direction = "decrease"                       ),                       nhs_icon_settings = list(                         show_variation_icons = TRUE,                         flag_last_point = TRUE,                         variation_icons_locations = "Top Right"                       ))  chart_var_last$static_plot # Data with shift in the middle, not at the end dat_var_middle <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   readmissions = c(rnorm(8, mean = 12, sd = 2),                    rnorm(8, mean = 16, sd = 2),  # Shift in middle                    rnorm(8, mean = 12, sd = 2))  # Back to baseline )  chart_var_middle <- spc(data = dat_var_middle,                         keys = month,                         numerators = readmissions,                         spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                         outlier_settings = list(                           astronomical = TRUE,                           shift = TRUE,                           improvement_direction = "decrease"                         ),                         nhs_icon_settings = list(                           show_variation_icons = TRUE,                           flag_last_point = TRUE,                           variation_icons_locations = "Top Right"                         ))  chart_var_middle$static_plot chart_var_all <- spc(data = dat_var_middle,                      keys = month,                      numerators = readmissions,                      spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                      outlier_settings = list(                        astronomical = TRUE,                        shift = TRUE,                        improvement_direction = "decrease"                      ),                      nhs_icon_settings = list(                        show_variation_icons = TRUE,                        flag_last_point = FALSE,                        variation_icons_locations = "Top Right"                      ))  chart_var_all$static_plot chart_var_bl <- spc(data = dat_var_last,                     keys = month,                     numerators = readmissions,                     spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                     outlier_settings = list(                       astronomical = TRUE,                       shift = TRUE,                       improvement_direction = "decrease"                     ),                     nhs_icon_settings = list(                       show_variation_icons = TRUE,                       variation_icons_locations = "Bottom Left",                       variation_icons_scaling = 1.2                     ))  chart_var_bl$static_plot

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: Assurance icons indicate whether process consistently meeting target threshold. Important: Assurance icons require alt_target value specified line_settings. assurance status depends position alt_target relative 99% control limits: Consistent Pass: Target lower 99% limit (process consistently exceeds target) Consistent Fail: Target upper 99% limit (process consistently target) Variable: Target within 99% limits (process sometimes meets, sometimes doesn’t)

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: alt_target lower 99% control limit, process consistently exceeds target:
code: # Process centered around 95%, target at 90% will be below lower 99% limit dat_assurance_pass <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   vaccination_rate = rnorm(24, mean = 95, sd = 1) )  chart_assurance_pass <- spc(data = dat_assurance_pass,                             keys = month,                             numerators = vaccination_rate,                             spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                             nhs_icon_settings = list(                               show_assurance_icons = TRUE,                               assurance_icons_locations = "Top Right"                             ),                             line_settings = list(                               show_alt_target = TRUE,                               alt_target = 90,                               colour_alt_target = "#E69F00"                             ))  chart_assurance_pass$static_plot knitr::kable(tail(chart_assurance_pass$limits, 6), digits = 2)

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: alt_target upper 99% control limit, process consistently fails meet target:
code: # Process centered around 82%, target at 90% will be above upper 99% limit dat_assurance_fail <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   vaccination_rate = rnorm(24, mean = 82, sd = 1.5) )  chart_assurance_fail <- spc(data = dat_assurance_fail,                             keys = month,                             numerators = vaccination_rate,                             spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                             nhs_icon_settings = list(                               show_assurance_icons = TRUE,                               assurance_icons_locations = "Top Right"                             ),                             line_settings = list(                               show_alt_target = TRUE,                               alt_target = 90,                               colour_alt_target = "#E69F00"                             ))  chart_assurance_fail$static_plot knitr::kable(tail(chart_assurance_fail$limits, 6), digits = 2)

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: alt_target falls within 99% control limits, performance variable:
code: # Process centered around 90%, target at 90% will be within limits dat_assurance_variable <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date("2024-01-01"), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   vaccination_rate = rnorm(24, mean = 90, sd = 2) )  chart_assurance_variable <- spc(data = dat_assurance_variable,                                 keys = month,                                 numerators = vaccination_rate,                                 spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                                 nhs_icon_settings = list(                                   show_assurance_icons = TRUE,                                   assurance_icons_locations = "Top Right"                                 ),                                 line_settings = list(                                   show_alt_target = TRUE,                                   alt_target = 90,                                   colour_alt_target = "#E69F00"                                 ))  chart_assurance_variable$static_plot knitr::kable(tail(chart_assurance_variable$limits, 6), digits = 2)

title: Outlier Detection and NHS Icons
text: can display icon types simultaneously:
code: chart_both_icons <- spc(data = dat_assurance_pass,                         keys = month,                         numerators = vaccination_rate,                         spc_settings = list(chart_type = "i"),                         outlier_settings = list(                           astronomical = TRUE,                           shift = TRUE,                           trend = TRUE,                           improvement_direction = "increase"                         ),                         nhs_icon_settings = list(                           show_variation_icons = TRUE,                           show_assurance_icons = TRUE                         ),                         line_settings = list(                           show_alt_target = TRUE,                           alt_target = 90,                           colour_alt_target = "#E69F00"                         ))  chart_both_icons$static_plot

what: Interactive Plotting for Funnel and Statistical Process Control Charts
title: Interactive Plotting for Funnel and Statistical Process Control Charts
text: controlcharts package aims provide comprehensive set tools calculating visualising statistical process control (SPC) charts funnel plots R. package implemented wrapper around existing code Power BI custom visuals SPC Charts Funnel Plots. data pre-processing, calculation control limits, plotting functions implemented Javascript, provides powerful flexibility use interactive contexts.

title: Interactive Plotting for Funnel and Statistical Process Control Charts
text: can install development version controlcharts GitHub : can install pre-built binaries R-Universe:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("AUS-DOH-Safety-and-Quality/controlcharts") install.packages("controlcharts", repos = c("https://AUS-DOH-Safety-and-Quality.r-universe.dev",                                             "https://cran.r-project.org"))

title: Interactive Plotting for Funnel and Statistical Process Control Charts
text: Consider basic time-series, comprised two-years monthly data: default, spc() function construct -chart (individuals chart; also referred XmR-chart): result spc() function list containing three elements: static_plot: static SVG plot SPC chart html_plot: HTML widget containing interactive SPC chart (use Shiny/interactive contexts) limits: data frame containing calculated control limits
code: # Simulate 2 years of monthly data dat <- data.frame(   month = seq(as.Date('2024-01-01'), length.out = 24, by = "month"),   y = rnorm(24) )  knitr::kable(head(dat)) spc_chart <- controlcharts::spc(data = dat,                                 numerators = y,                                 keys = month) spc_chart$static_plot # If you are using an interactive environment, you can display the HTML widget: # spc_chart$html_plot # Display the control limits knitr::kable(head(spc_chart$limits), digits = 2)

title: Interactive Plotting for Funnel and Statistical Process Control Charts
text: interface provided funnel charts. example, consider proportion data recorded 10 organisations: funnel plots, default proportions (PR) chart:
code: # Simulate proportion data for 10 organisations denoms <- sample(100:200, 10) funnel_data <- data.frame(   organisation = letters[1:10],   numerators = rbinom(10, size = denoms, prob = 0.2),   denominators = denoms )  knitr::kable(funnel_data) funnel_chart <- controlcharts::funnel(data = funnel_data,                                        numerators = numerators,                                        denominators = denominators,                                        keys = organisation) funnel_chart$static_plot knitr::kable(funnel_chart$limits, digits = 2)

title: Generate interactive Funnel chart — funnel
code: funnel(   data,   keys,   numerators,   denominators,   tooltips,   labels,   aggregations = list(numerators = "sum", denominators = "sum", tooltips = "first",     labels = "first"),   title = NULL,   canvas_settings = NULL,   funnel_settings = NULL,   outlier_settings = NULL,   scatter_settings = NULL,   line_settings = NULL,   x_axis_settings = NULL,   y_axis_settings = NULL,   label_settings = NULL,   tooltip_settings = NULL,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   elementId = NULL )

title: Generate interactive Funnel chart — funnel
text: data data frame containing data chart. keys vector column name representing categories chart. numerators numeric vector column name representing numerators category. denominators numeric vector column name representing denominators category. tooltips vector column name representing tooltips category. labels vector column name representing labels category. aggregations list aggregation function names field multiple values provided key. Valid options : "first": returns first value "last": returns last value "sum": returns sum values "mean": returns mean values "min": returns minimum value "max": returns maximum value "median": returns median value "count": returns count values title Optional title added top chart. can character string title text , list following options: text: Title text (default: NULL) font_size: Font size title (default: "16px") font_weight: Font weight title (default: "bold") font_family: Font family title (default: "'Arial', sans-serif") x: Horizontal (x) position title percentage (default: "50%") y: Vertical (y) position title pixels (default: 5) text_anchor: Text anchor title (default: "middle") dominant_baseline: Dominant baseline title (default: "hanging") canvas_settings Optional list settings canvas, see funnel_default_settings('canvas') valid options. funnel_settings Optional list settings Funnel chart, see funnel_default_settings("funnel") valid options. outlier_settings Optional list settings outliers, see funnel_default_settings('outliers') valid options. scatter_settings Optional list settings scatter points, see funnel_default_settings('scatter') valid options. line_settings Optional list settings lines, see funnel_default_settings('lines') valid options. x_axis_settings Optional list settings x-axis, see funnel_default_settings('x_axis') valid options. y_axis_settings Optional list settings y-axis, see funnel_default_settings('y_axis') valid options. label_settings Optional list settings labels, see funnel_default_settings('labels') valid options. tooltip_settings Optional list settings tooltips, see funnel_default_settings('tooltips') valid options. width Optional width chart pixels. NULL (default), chart fill width container. height Optional height chart pixels. NULL (default), chart fill height container. elementId Optional HTML element ID chart.

title: Generate interactive Funnel chart — funnel

code: spcOutput(outputId, width = "100%", height = "400px")  renderSpc(expr, env = parent.frame(), quoted = FALSE)

title: Shiny bindings for wrapper — spc-shiny
text: outputId output variable read width, height Must valid CSS unit (like '100%', '400px', 'auto') number, coerced string 'px' appended. expr expression generates wrapper env environment evaluate expr. quoted expr quoted expression (quote())? useful want save expression variable.

title: Generate interactive SPC chart — spc
text: Generate interactive SPC chart

title: Generate interactive SPC chart — spc
code: spc(   data,   keys,   numerators,   denominators,   groupings,   xbar_sds,   tooltips,   labels,   aggregations = list(numerators = "sum", denominators = "sum", groupings = "first",     xbar_sds = "first", tooltips = "first", labels = "first"),   title = NULL,   canvas_settings = NULL,   spc_settings = NULL,   outlier_settings = NULL,   nhs_icon_settings = NULL,   scatter_settings = NULL,   line_settings = NULL,   x_axis_settings = NULL,   y_axis_settings = NULL,   date_settings = NULL,   label_settings = NULL,   tooltip_settings = NULL,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   elementId = NULL )

title: Generate interactive SPC chart — spc
text: data data frame containing data chart. keys vector column name representing categories (x-axis) chart. numerators numeric vector column name representing numerators category. denominators numeric vector column name representing denominators category. groupings vector column name representing grouping category. xbar_sds numeric vector column name representing x-bar standard deviation values category. tooltips vector column name representing tooltips category. labels vector column name representing labels category. aggregations list aggregation function names field multiple values provided key. Valid options : "first": returns first value "last": returns last value "sum": returns sum values "mean": returns mean values "min": returns minimum value "max": returns maximum value "median": returns median value "count": returns count values title Optional title added top chart. can character string title text , list following options: text: Title text (default: NULL) font_size: Font size title (default: "16px") font_weight: Font weight title (default: "bold") font_family: Font family title (default: "'Arial', sans-serif") x: Horizontal (x) position title percentage (default: "50%") y: Vertical (y) position title pixels (default: 5) text_anchor: Text anchor title (default: "middle") dominant_baseline: Dominant baseline title (default: "hanging") canvas_settings Optional list settings canvas, see spc_default_settings('canvas') valid options. spc_settings Optional list settings SPC chart, see spc_default_settings('spc') valid options. outlier_settings Optional list settings outliers, see spc_default_settings('outliers') valid options. nhs_icon_settings Optional list settings NHS icons, see spc_default_settings('nhs_icons') valid options. scatter_settings Optional list settings scatter points, see spc_default_settings('scatter') valid options. line_settings Optional list settings lines, see spc_default_settings('lines') valid options. x_axis_settings Optional list settings x-axis, see spc_default_settings('x_axis') valid options. y_axis_settings Optional list settings y-axis, see spc_default_settings('y_axis') valid options. date_settings Optional list settings dates, see spc_default_settings('dates') valid options. label_settings Optional list settings labels, see spc_default_settings('labels') valid options. tooltip_settings Optional list settings tooltips, see spc_default_settings('tooltips') valid options. width Optional width chart pixels. NULL (default), chart fill width container. height Optional height chart pixels. NULL (default), chart fill height container. elementId Optional HTML element ID chart.

title: Generate interactive SPC chart — spc
text: object class controlchart containing interactive plot, static plot, limits data frame, raw data, function save plot.
